subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Why do entities lie?
author: don powell
full_text:
--0-1267965246-1260398627=:68562
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable



I've always loved this end of the world stuff.  The way I see it, if the =
world ends, I'm dead and I don't care.  I could just as easily die tomorrow=
 driving to work.  So if there is something you should do while you are ali=
ve then do it.  Otherwise who cares about worlds ending?

Don



__________=
______________________
From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...>
To:=
 EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wed, December 9, 2009 3:24:46 PM
Subject: Re=
: [EVP-ITC] Why do entities lie?

  
 I've been doing "box" work for almost=
 ten years, and I still get to the decepticons( liars). Perhaps it's just a=
 level out there, as I think there is an inifinite number of levels and/or =
demensions. Maybe there is a demonic level? I have a group that communicate=
s, and they usually tell "this is an apple", a metaphor for a truth. Not al=
l of these voices are spirit per se`, some have never been human, there is =
a group out there called the fish group, a group of entities that exist off=
 planet and really enjoy screwing with EVPers.  I think it was the people-I=
 forget their names, experimenting in Luxemberg quite some time ago that fi=
rst got the Fish Group. 
 
 For me, I don't really care what comes through,=
 it's the fact that something talks that shouldn't be there, my approach ha=
sd always been on the technical side. 
 
 I get some mediumistic contacts/v=
isions, and I have some spirits that seemingly prefer telepathic contacts, =
but I don't take that as anymore gosple than anything else. Most of the "co=
mmunication" tends to be extremely trivial in nature. 
 
 As far as end of =
the world stuff, I do get that, alot of it, in almost every session, they i=
nsist it's true, at least as far as end of the cycle goes, but, and it's a =
big but, who knows what level/source that is from--they claim not to be hum=
an. Plus we do have access to the future, if I do my meditation regularly I=
 see almost everything ahead of time, plus I dream it, and I know everyone =
on this planet. I would expect spirit to be much more aware, at least after=
 they reach a higher state. Human is not the highest level, so you can't co=
mpare everything to what y'all think you know. 
 
 Frank-S
 
 
 


 
On Wed=
, Dec 9, 2009 at 11:47 AM, michellewisbith <mwisbith@hotmail. com> wrote:

=
  
>
>
>Hello, all.
>
>My name is Michelle. I'm a certified medium with a S=
piritualist church. This was a two year process which involved proving I ca=
n communicate with spirits to a congregation (not bragging - just trying to=
 explain my background and why I know what I do). I'm also one of the bigge=
st skeptics you'll ever meet (It was one of two reasons I became a medium. =
I wanted to see how they were "faking" it. Surprise! They weren't). I'd lik=
e to contribute what I've learned about spirits. As Jill wrote, "I(t) reall=
y takes personal experience to believe this stuff exists".
>
>As to her mai=
n question of "Why do spirits lie", I don't think we can always assume they=
're lying. If the information comes through a medium, one of the first item=
s to address is whether or not the medium received the message correctly an=
d then whether or not he/she interepreted it correctly and phrased it in a =
way that allowed the recipient to understand the spirit's meaning. There ar=
e a variety of ways spirits communicate with mediums; some are easier than =
others to understand and pass on. For the harder methods, it would be possi=
ble for a medium to inadvertently misinterept the message based on his/her =
past experiences. 
>
>When we look at the question from the connection to E=
VP's and ghost boxes, we have to examine a few items. Was the spirit able t=
o use the devices correctly to form the words he/she actually intended? Thi=
s is a two step process. It can be difficult for them to not only pull the =
available energy into a useable form, but to also form the correct words (t=
hink it as a foreigner learning English and saying "car" when they mean "st=
ar". They sound similar, but have very different meanings). 
>
>Did we unde=
rstand the words they said? It's fairly easy to get them wrong, especially =
in instances where you aren't the first person to listen to the recording a=
nd someone else says, "Here listen to this. I think they're saying (fill in=
 the blank)". Our brains are going to tell us (fill in the blank) simply be=
cause that thought is now prevalent. If we're the only person listening to =
the recordings, the same mistake can be made. The only conclusive way is to=
 use equipment that can amplify and break down the recordings to make them =
clear enough to be agreed upon by a number of people who don't know what co=
nclusions the other listeners have drawn. 
>
>The idea of a spirit distorti=
ng the facts must also be considered. Not lying, per se, but rather getting=
 the facts within their reality confused. This is where you have the right =
to have the facts validated by the spirit. Ask them to prove it to you. The=
y can tell you some corresponding items that back up their claims, direct y=
ou to old newspaper stories or to a person they used to affiliate with or b=
ring the validation into your focus (meaning the same thing comes into your=
 life while you're driving/working/ at home/talking to someone/reading and =
etc.) at least three times. A spirit who is being truthful will not mind tr=
ying to make this happen. 
>
>Once these have been considered and eliminate=
d, then we should be willing to entertain the idea the spirit may be a lowe=
r energy being (a bully/swindler/ con-man or woman/narcissist and etc) in t=
heir past life and this is the only way they know how to achieve what they =
want. And yes, those spirits do exist. "As in life, so in death", meaning o=
ur personalities don't change when our bodies die.
>
>Al, maybe he wasn't t=
rying to prove anything. Is it possible the spirit voice didn't mean he WAS=
 (typed larger for emphasis) Steve Tate, but rather wanted to talk ABOUT St=
eve Tate or get a message TO Steve Tate? Did he mean to say "Still fate"? C=
ould he have meant "paratrooper"? See where I'm going with this? 
>
>And fi=
nally, in regards to the "end of the world stuff", it has been taught to me=
 by mediums and teachers who were all very honest and excellent at what the=
y do, and it has been relayed to me by spirits I've encountered in my mediu=
mship service that we don't have a free glimpse of the future once our bodi=
es die and we move into spirit form. I mean no offense and I'm not impying =
that wasn't what was heard. That said (or rather 'typed'), I'd be VERY hesi=
tant to believe this communication. There are beings that are privvy to the=
 potential (underscore "potential") future in our lives, but it isn't their=
 nature to join us for EVP sessions. 
>
>I hope I haven't taken liberty wit=
h this forum by posting such a long reply. I thank you for your time and at=
tention. If you have other questions or would like me to clarify something,=
 please ask. I'd be honored to share what I know and track down what I don'=
t. :) 
>
>Michelle
>
>

<blockquote class=3D"gmail_quot=

<div>
<div>
<div>
<p><br><br>Hello, all.<br><br>M=
y name is Michelle. I'm a certified medium with a Spiritualist church. This=
 was a two year process which involved proving I can communicate with spiri=
ts to a congregation (not bragging - just trying to explain my background a=
nd why I know what I do). I'm also one of the biggest skeptics you'll ever =
meet (It was one of two reasons I became a medium. I wanted to see how they=
 were "faking" it. Surprise! They weren't). I'd like to contribute what I'v=
e learned about spirits. As Jill wrote, "I(t) really takes personal experie=
nce to believe this stuff exists".<br>
<br>As to her main question of "Why =
do spirits lie", I don't think we can always assume they're lying. If the i=
nformation comes through a medium, one of the first items to address is whe=
ther or not the medium received the message correctly and then whether or n=
ot he/she interepreted it correctly and phrased it in a way that allowed th=
e recipient to understand the spirit's meaning. There are a variety of ways=
 spirits communicate with mediums; some are easier than others to understan=
d and pass on. For the harder methods, it would be possible for a medium to=
 inadvertently misinterept the message based on his/her past experiences. <=
br>
<br>When we look at the question from the connection to EVP's and ghost=
 boxes, we have to examine a few items. Was the spirit able to use the devi=
ces correctly to form the words he/she actually intended? This is a two ste=
p process. It can be difficult for them to not only pull the available ener=
gy into a useable form, but to also form the correct words (think it as a f=
oreigner learning English and saying "car" when they mean "star". They soun=
d similar, but have very different meanings). <br>
<br>Did we understand th=
e words they said? It's fairly easy to get them wrong, especially in instan=
ces where you aren't the first person to listen to the recording and someon=
e else says, "Here listen to this. I think they're saying (fill in the blan=
k)". Our brains are going to tell us (fill in the blank) simply because tha=
t thought is now prevalent. If we're the only person listening to the recor=
dings, the same mistake can be made. The only conclusive way is to use equi=
pment that can amplify and break down the recordings to make them clear eno=
ugh to be agreed upon by a number of people who don't know what conclusions=
 the other listeners have drawn. <br>
<br>The idea of a spirit distorting t=
he facts must also be considered. Not lying, per se, but rather getting the=
 facts within their reality confused. This is where you have the right to h=
ave the facts validated by the spirit. Ask them to prove it to you. They ca=
n tell you some corresponding items that back up their claims, direct you t=
o old newspaper stories or to a person they used to affiliate with or bring=
 the validation into your focus (meaning the same thing comes into your lif=
e while you're driving/working/ at home/talking to someone/reading and etc.=
) at least three times. A spirit who is being truthful will not mind trying=
 to make this happen. <br>
<br>Once these have been considered and eliminat=
ed, then we should be willing to entertain the idea the spirit may be a low=
er energy being (a bully/swindler/ con-man or woman/narcissist and etc) in =
their past life and this is the only way they know how to achieve what they=
 want. And yes, those spirits do exist. "As in life, so in death", meaning =
our personalities don't change when our bodies die.<br>
<br>Al, maybe he wa=
sn't trying to prove anything. Is it possible the spirit voice didn't mean =
he WAS (typed larger for emphasis) Steve Tate, but rather wanted to talk AB=
OUT Steve Tate or get a message TO Steve Tate? Did he mean to say "Still fa=
te"? Could he have meant "paratrooper"? See where I'm going with this? <br>=

<br>And finally, in regards to the "end of the world stuff", it has been t=
aught to me by mediums and teachers who were all very honest and excellent =
at what they do, and it has been relayed to me by spirits I've encountered =
in my mediumship service that we don't have a free glimpse of the future on=
ce our bodies die and we move into spirit form. I mean no offense and I'm n=
ot impying that wasn't what was heard. That said (or rather 'typed'), I'd b=
e VERY hesitant to believe this communication. There are beings that are pr=
ivvy to the potential (underscore "potential") future in our lives, but it =
isn't their nature to join us for EVP sessions. <br>
<br>I hope I haven't t=
aken liberty with this forum by posting such a long reply. I thank you for =
your time and attention. If you have other questions or would like me to cl=
arify something, please ask. I'd be honored to share what I know and track =
down what I don't. :) <br>
<br>Michelle<br><br></p></div>
